title: (2860) Moita - 5 Largo Doutor Joaquim Marques Elias
title_short: (2860) Moita - 5 Largo Doutor Joaquim Marques Elias
description: Parking in the municipal hall, water point nearby. I stayed 2 nights for the festival. Very quiet at night, many shops nearby.

title: (2860-632) Gaio-Rosário - 36 Rua Eça de Queiroz

title: (2860-626) Gaio-Rosário - 20 Largo das Forças Armadas
description: Picnic park located on the edge of the salt water river, where it is possible for motorhomes to stay overnight for up to 72 hours, completely free of charge.

title: (2835-022) Baixa da Banheira - 36 Avenida Capitães de Abril
title_short: (2835-022) Baixa da Banheira - 36 Avenida Capitães de Abril
description: Fabulous park with lots of trees, tables, barbecues, good views, very quiet. I spent two days very well. The taps are near the barbecues, if you can get water with a jerrycan. If you can park on asphalt or dirt, as you prefer.

title: (2870) Montijo - 79 Rua Miguel Pais
description: Car park right by the river and at Montijo downtown. Restaurants, bars and other services close by.

title: (2870) Montijo - D Estrada do Seixalinho

title: (2870) Montijo - E90
description: Parking at the Forum Montijo shopping center. With all the facilities of a shopping center a few steps away (like the Continente supermarket and pharmacies).

title: (2955) Pinhal Novo - R da Cascalheira

title: (2830) Barreiro - Avenida Escola dos Fuzileiros Navais
title_short: (2830) Barreiro - Avenida Escola dos Fuzileiros Navais
description: Place under trees with easy access from the main road. During the night some cars went by but haven’t had a problem. Felt quite safe for 1 night.

title: (2955-058) Palmela - 99 Rua Lagoa da Palha
description: Large parking belonging to the parish, no ban, no service. Close to nature, quiet to sleep or a stop.

name: Camping Vasco da Gama
title: () Camping Vasco da Gama
description: It is a natural permanent campsite where people live all year round. The rear part in the pine forest is reserved for tourists. Motorhome, mobile home, caravan or tent Pitch of your choice. Everything is fenced, the gate is closed from 00:00. Until then arrival is possible. You pay 24 hours. Disposal of chemical toilets is possible. Super clean sanitary facilities, but no glasses or paper. The water in the shower is very hot and flows continuously. In summer there is a swimming pool. There is a small private animal park with poultry, a pond and a garden. There are picnic areas and additional barbecue areas. Pets are allowed.

title: (2870-327) Montijo - 2870 Via Circular do Montijo
description: Repsol gas station with good LPG price. You can also buy a Propane Bottle here.

title: (2955-009) Palmela - 99 Rua Lagoa da Palha
description: Washing machines intermarket parking. Washing machines.

title: (2870-087) Montijo - 135 Avenida Dom Afonso v
description: A full service laundry even with ironing. As of now, free parking “behind” the building

title: (2830-302) Barreiro - 9 Rua João de Deus
description: Point of sale for Camping-Gaz bottles ref 907

title: (2870) Atalaia - 2127 N4
description: Large empty parking lot at night. we spent the night there without any worries you have trash cans available.

title: (2870) Atalaia - Escadaria do Adro da Igreja
title_short: (2870) Atalaia - Escadaria do Adro da Igreja
description: Large quiet parking (we were alone) facing the church.  Behind houses but not far from the road.  Away but not isolated so perfect for a night of rest.  Wc closed at night

title: (2830-302) Barreiro - 16 Rua Anibal Pereira Fernandes
description: Free residence área to park anda sleep Wirthout service... safety.

title: (2870) Atalaia - 52 Rua dos Círios
description: Quiet parking for one night behind the church. So hard to find a place in the area. The church bells start ringing at 7:00 a.m. every 15 minutes.

title: (2830) Coina - 43 Rua Professora Maria Rita Amaro Duarte
title_short: (2830) Coina - 43 Rua Professora Maria Rita Amaro Duarte

address.street: 43 Rua Professora Maria Rita Amaro Duarte

title: () Palmela - E1
description:
Typical gas station along the highway, free hot showers in the building behind the shop,
ask for a key in the shop (in exchange for a passport).

title_short: (2890) Samouco - Acesso à Área de Serviço de Alcochete
description: Gas station Galp next to the Vasco de Gama bridge with a King burguer with rich breakfasts, picnic area, free showers and clean and spacious bathrooms. The bathrooms close from 22: 00-7: 30. You can park next to the showers and bathrooms. Possibility of refilling water from the gas station. ideal for a night. In the vicinity there is nothing special.

address.street: Acesso à Área de Serviço de Alcochete

title: (2951-901) Palmela - E90
description: Picnic area with toilets and a shower.

title: (2830-356) Barreiro - 55-5 Rua Miguel Pais
description: Laundry service. It has wifi, tv.

title: (2890) Samouco - 15 Rua da Praia
description: Free parking in front of the small fishing port. View of Tejo and Vasco da Gama Bridge. No service. Good for a night.

title: (2830-322) Barreiro - 11 Rua Bento de Jesus Caraça
title_short: (2830-322) Barreiro - 11 Rua Bento de Jesus Caraça
description: Big car park with river view. No amenities but there is cafes and restaurants nearby. Safe to stay overnight. Close to the beach.

title: (2830) Barreiro - 11 Rua Bento de Jesus Caraça
title_short: (2830) Barreiro - 11 Rua Bento de Jesus Caraça
description:
Beside the motoclub of Barreiro (cheap beers) and in front of a school
5 minutes from the ferry terminal to Lisbon

title: (2830) Barreiro - Rua do Clu. Naval Barreirense
title_short: (2830) Barreiro - Rua do Clu. Naval Barreirense
description: Big car park near the beach. Free shower at the beach (cold). Close to a bar, which can be a bit noisy during the summer and on weekends.

title: (2830) Coina - E1
description:
Sandy parking area close to the train station. A lot of people park here to go to work by train. 
Not a nice place to stay over night as there is the road nearby, but perfect if you want to visit Lisbon by train

title: (2840) Seixal - 1405 Avenida Mud Juvenil
description:
Car park of the Transtejo ferry company. From here, passenger ferries go directly to the center of Lisbon. There is an aqua park right next to the parking lot. Nice view over the Tagus on Lisbon.

Update 2023:
The left, illuminated part is quiet. After the barrier left. The darker area on the right is occasionally occupied by the village youth at night.
The place is guarded (Mon-Fri, 9-21).
Parking is free on weekends, otherwise 1.20 per day.
The last ferry back is at 11:15 p.m. Depending on the season, the ferry costs €5.00 - €5.50 (round trip). Exact timetables in Google Maps.

title: (2975-311) Quinta do Conde - Rua Humberto Delgado
title_short: (2975-311) Quinta do Conde - Rua Humberto Delgado
description: Free parking. If you have a simple van you can stay the night but not if you have a proper camping car. There's also cheap supermarkets around and take-away shops. The view is nice since it's the parking of a park

title: (2840) Seixal - 9 Avenida Albano Narciso Pereira
description: Laundry Dan's the Lidl car park

title: (2840) - 12 Praceta Emídio Santana
description: Parking in a small industrial area. we had lunch in the shade of the trees. I think there are no problems to spend even the night. quiet and sheltered

title: (2890-532) Alcochete - Praia das Salinas
description:
Perfect to stand here overlooking the bridge, sandy bottom but lots of firm spots. Access is a bit bumpy for a very short distance but. We are standing here with a length of 8m, no problem.
Perfect for a night or two free standing. Beach, sand, peace and view. What more do you want.

title: (2845) Amora - Unnamed Road
description: Awesome place at the very end of the land. Ample space with bbqs and tables. There are tables in the sun as well as in the shade. There is a sign that prohibits camping in this particular area but we stayed a night without problems. Honestly I don’t imagine the police driving all the way in just to tell you to move, and if they do all you have to do is move a bit and you are ok. There are also many places where you can stop while coming in to this spot so really spoilt for choice. There is a water tap that we found working but no handle. So you need to use a plier or something to open it (like we did ). I don’t know if they can close the main supply though. Trust me give this place a shot and leave a comment below.

title: (2840-520) Seixal - 1 Praça Mártires da Liberdade
description: Parking on the edge of town, view of the ferry connecting seixal to Lisbon, very peaceful night with shops, cafe, restaurant and bakery right next door. No parking ban

title: (2870-145) Alcochete - Unnamed Road
description: More natural car park than the others in the city, on the banks of the river next to the marsh area, view of the capital. No amenities, very good internet network for telecommuting... No one in the off-season, perfect for a quiet night or two.

title: (2890) Alcochete - 259 Rua Cerradinho da Praia
description: Parking near park at night closed, safe place for van

title: (2890-167) Alcochete - 92 Rua das Descobertas
description: Alcochete, Portugal, Free Park,, No Service Area

title: (2840) Seixal - Av Albano Narciso Pereira
description: Next to the kulturforum there are four levels of large parking spaces, for mobile homes up to 6 m or at the Süberhang to 7 m

title: (2890-167) Alcochete - 185 Avenida Infante D.João
description: Beach overlooking Lisbon. A beach bar, showers and foot baths, sports equipment and free wi fi. Place where to park the motorhome 50 m from the beach. I think there will be no problem with the overnight stay. This area should be avoided from the 9th to the 16th of August, at least for parking or overnight accommodation of vehicles that can cause traffic problems, since at that time the festivities of the land (parties of Barrete Verde) take place. Moreover, they can park in the surroundings and go to the party by other means, since they are very beautiful and traditional parties. In June, the parrot festival takes place on this beach.

title: (2840-733) Arrentela - 168 Rua Casal do Marco
description: Large and calm parking spot. In the end of the park have a self service laundry with free Wifi. Near to the train station to go to Lisbon or the bus station with a lot of lines, one of them for the train station if you can't walk.

title: (2950) Palmela - 2 Rua Manuel Verissimo da Silva
title_short: (2950) Palmela - 2 Rua Manuel Verissimo da Silva
description: Easy parking. Especially good for avoiding at the weekend when the parking lot of the Castelo de Palmela gets a little louder again. You're on the ground floor, it's quiet at night and you don't bother anyone.

title: (2840) Arrentela -
description:
Parking near the road, a little noisy but ideal for spending the night.
we slept here to visit Lisbon

title: (2950-313) Palmela - 3 Avenida Visconde Tojal
description: Natural gas is for sale. They can borrow 2 adapters but the two did not match.

title: (2890) Alcochete -
description: Very nice place next to the beach and the park. I drove here at 2 at night because the other spot on park4night was very noisy on a Friday. That was a good decision.

title: (2890-014) Alcochete -
description: Parking where we stayed one night without any difficulty. calm. 1 hour from Lisbon.

title: (2890) Alcochete - 599 Avenida Dom Manuel I
description: A quiet place in a parking space near the Tagus with a stunning view of the city of Lisbon and the Vasco da Gama bridge

title: (2950-218) Palmela - 1 Largo dos Loureiros
description: Public parking next to public gym and 5min to public swimming pool with hot showers . High up in historical part of the village, very quiet at night with great walks around the site… only thing is rubbish collection truck comes at 7am otherwise great spot,good restaurants and coffee shops around .

title: (2890-013) Alcochete - 196 Rua Dona Maria Teresa de Noronha
title_short: (2890-013) Alcochete - 196 Rua Dona Maria Teresa de Noronha
description: Laundry shop with 3 washing machines   3 drying machines. If you buy the client card, you save money. You can park in a big dirt car park very near. Several supermarkets in the area.

address.street: 196 Rua Dona Maria Teresa de Noronha

title: (2845) Amora - 84 Avenida Silva Gomes
description: Leclerc Hypermarket, washing, fuels, lpg, very beautiful ballads at the edge of the water with fitness exercises to unlock the muscles.

title: (2950) Palmela - 2 Avenida dos Cavaleiros de Santiago e Espada
title_short: (2950) Palmela - 2 Avenida dos Cavaleiros de Santiago e Espada
description: Flat parking with magnificent views. A lot of passage. Trash, no service. Going through the village attention; narrow streets; and not more than 3,5 t

address.street: 2 Avenida dos Cavaleiros de Santiago e Espada

title: () Alcochete - 237 N119
description: Close by night! Hyper ample free parking hyper Freeport shopping center. Without service.

name: Quinta das Kopas
title: (2955-252) Quinta das Kopas
description:
Check-in 12:00-21:00     |    Check-out 7h30-14h00

Quinta das Kopas is a little private rural farm where you can stay in the middle of the fruit trees.
Excellent location to visit Lisbon as it is only 30 minutes from Lisbon by train. The station is just 2 km away and we will drop you off and pick you up for free.
We have facilities such as hot water showers, toilets, place to wash dishes, barbecue, washing machine, washing line, a gym and a living room (with tv and board games), as well as places to dump and refill water (only for those who sleep on the farm).
There is also a small warm salt water pool, about 33º (different hours for adults and children) and a jacuzzi if you really want to get completely relaxed.
You can also rest, read, listen to music or even sleep on the hammocks or in other seating and lying areas of our garden. But if your idea is to be a little more active, you can play our outdoor games.
Sociable pets are welcome (free of charge) but must always be on a leash and cannot be in the common interior spaces (vaccination card required).
We also have a mobile home for travelers without a motorhome or friends of our guests.
Quinta das Kopas was designed to welcome friends from different countries who want to take a break from their journey and enjoy Portuguese nature and hospitality.
Please come with google maps to make it easier to reach the gate. It is on a dead-end street and is the first gate on the left with the nameplate on the wall. (Attention: waze does not bring you to the gate).
Please check prices.

Reservation is not mandatory, but if you really want to secure your place, it would be better to get in touch with us because our capacity is per person.

name: Quinta do Sol
title: (2950) Quinta do Sol
description:
Quinta do Sol
Family rural property, with the possibility of staying overnight.
contact me before arrival

name: A CASA DO LAGO
title: (2925) A CASA DO LAGO
description:
This place was built by Paolo and Lina themselves. Travelers themselves, so from travelers for travelers ;-)

In the garden there is a room with toilet and shower (cold free, hot payment), a room with washing machine, a shared fridge and a mini gym. Also a swimming pool in the garden and an outdoor shower (cold). Furthermore, many seating areas and areas where tents can be placed. The two dogs often walk around here.

The house consists of Paolo and Lina's living quarters and a guest house.

Next to the garden is a gravel field where campers can park. A number of animals live here (rabbit, ducks, chickens) and there is an organically landscaped garden.

The campsite is located in an area with many vineyards, cheeses, beaches and good restaurants. Paolo and Lina are happy to recommend their tips!

title: (2950-011) Palmela - 54 Avenida Antoine Velge
description: Clean laundry, parking directly in front (possibly a bit difficult with a larger camper). Washing machines: 12, 16, 20 kg

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Super quiet with views to Lisbon and Sintra. I would recommend approaching this place from Capela de São Gonçalo. This route has some tight bends but the road is in fairly good condition, which is not the case with the other two roads leading from east to west. I went there via Capela das Necessidades and would only recommend this approach. You hate your car ;) The height limit is 2.8m coming from the north due to the trees. Maybe 3m is fine too, but I'd recommend a spotter to be sure. Impassable road from the east

title: (2975-311) Quinta do Conde - 1542 Rua 31 de Janeiro
title_short: (2975-311) Quinta do Conde - 1542 Rua 31 de Janeiro
description:
Urban Park area surrounded by houses. 
not the best place but we Park here because was too late for continue the trip.

title: () Palmela - CM1054
description: Beautiful place in nature where building materials are stored

title: (2950) Palmela - Rua Custódio Simões
description: Location in a pine forest with views of Setubal

title: (2865) Fernão Ferro - Rua Ponta de Sagres 8
title_short: (2865) Fernão Ferro - Rua Ponta de Sagres 8
description: This area is a private park and it is possible to reserve by phone. It is possible to park 10 motorhome with access to the services described in the listing. Nocturnal noise and parties are not permitted. During the day you can use the barbecue and the swimming pool. You must call Antonio to confirm availability and times.

title: (2950) Palmela - 19 Alexandre Herculano
description: They sell LPG but do not have to borrow adapters.

title: (2890) Alcochete - Estrada das Hortas
description: It is an abandoned nature interpretation center. It has utilities and water that can be used. It is a quiet and safe neighborhood. There is a bar next to the water. Do not enter the dirt road high risk of getting stuck.

title: (2925-129) Azeitão - 21 Rua Cruz Perdigão
description: Small square with a fountain near school and tennis as well as local restaurant bars

title: (2925) Azeitão - R. Antiga Fabrica do Tomate
title_short: (2925) Azeitão - R. Antiga Fabrica do Tomate
description: Calm parking spot, near nice restaurants and shops with a nice view of Serra da Arrábida in the distance.

name: Quinta Lusco-Fusco
title: (2890) Quinta Lusco-Fusco
description: Quinta Lusco-Fusco is a private rural farm lets stay overnight for travelers by van, tent, bike, backpack, camping under the stars, in the shade of the cork oak, listening to the birds, seeing the farm animals. It is just 30 minutes from Lisbon. Only cold shower. Call before arrival.

title: (2950-055) Setúbal -
description: Remote spot with magnificent views of the Portinho da Arrabida mountains. There is nothing here but nature and silence (and good 4G internet). The gravel place is right next to the gravel road that leads here. The course is slightly sloping, but if you line up cleverly it shouldn't be a problem at all. I can only strongly recommend the access from the south from the N10. Then the Campo-Weg is only short and easy to master even with normal vehicles. There is no need for a 4x4. From other directions, depending on the path you take, the access road is sometimes very steep and bumpy. Out of your own interest: this place is still relatively clean. Please make sure it stays that way and respect Mother Earth!!!

title: (2950) Quinta do Anjo -
description: Space for about 4 vehicles or more if parked in the grass. Next to a quiet house. The path is not accessible for the camper (gravel road). Only suitable for vans.

title: (2950) Palmela -
description: Quiet and easy to access place next to a picnic area with picnic tables and barbecue facilities

title: (2925-237) Azeitão - 31 Rua Margarida Caineta
description: Calm public spot to park day/night in an pine tree park near Serra da Arrábida and Vila Nogueira de Azeitão.

name: Pura Terra
title: (2925) Pura Terra
description: Off-grid family farm called Pura Terra Azeitão, where you can park in a quiet and safe place, surrounded by trees, in the center of Azeitão, perfect for digital nomads, travelling families with young children, couples with alternative lifestyle, everyone who loves nature and outdoor living, travelers who need to take a rest, etc. There are some commodities nearby: Supermarket (500m), self-service laundry (1km), pharmacies (1.5km), black water and sewage (13km), gas bottle service (500m or delivery service), beaches and hiking trails can be reached in 10/15 minutes by car, swimming pool and paddling places (1, 2km), horse riding and wine tasting (1km), and many other activities on site, such as yoga classes and meditation circles, holistic therapies, etc. We may also offer free Wi-Fi and we have a dry compost toilet on site. Hot water shower is under construction. The parking is payed by conscious donation. For longer stays we can also agree to exchange the overnights for help in the farm, that we much need! You can contact us trough WhatsApp. Looking forward to host you!❤️

title: (2925) São Simão - 8 Rua Almirante Reis
description: Nice place in a small old village with water and places to visit

title: (1100) Lisboa -
description: Free parking on the street next to a main road. We only park for a visit, we don't spend the night, the area is quiet but the road and the train can be annoying to sleep. The area is completely flat.

title: (1100) Lisboa - 73B Avenida Infante Dom Henrique
description: Without service, noisy during the day, but 1minute from the station (with supermarket), subway, bus. Do not take the P24h, but go under the building (U-turn at the end of the road). Give a small room to the guy who "helps" to park, you will feel safer (seems to be customary on this car park). During the week, empty at the end of the afternoon. I stayed here for 3 nights without a problem

title: (1900-319) Lisboa - 40 Rua da Manutenção
description: I have been here without any problem. I felt safe leaving the van while in the city center. 15 'with the bike. A 3 'walk away there is a Lidl where I have seen that the parking lot shared with a pharmacy is often open so 1-2 vans were there at night. Just behind the BP gas station there is a little street where I did see 2 motorhomes staying overnight but as the street is very dark at night I don't dare park there. Maybe it's okay. At night I slept peacefully without any problem. The place where I put it would advise it for vans and not caravans. For motorhomes I think it's better just behind the BP gas station

title: (2865) Fernão Ferro - 86 Rua Carlos de Oliveira
title_short: (2865) Fernão Ferro - 86 Rua Carlos de Oliveira
description: Unpaved parking directly at the skatepark. Some trees offer shade. Other than the barking of dogs in the neighborhood, it's a pretty quiet place.

title: (1100) Lisboa - 2 Rua de Santa Apolónia
description: Parking a bit away from the city centre, a 15-minute walk to the District of alfama close to the train station a. no service but not negligible to Park! We stayed for the day but sleep opportunity but a lot of noise because of the great axes

title: (1100-475) Lisboa - Campo de Santa Clara
description: Very central and it’s quiet at Night. It’s one of the rare free and flat parking lots of Lisboa. In the morning you probably get woken up by a siren of the small military base (or maybe school) next to the parking area. At the daytime you can use the toilets of cafe clara.

title: (1950) Lisboa - 23 Rua Cintura do Porto
description: Parking by the docks, quiet, no height limitation.

title: (1100-470) Lisboa - 220B Campo de Santa Clara
description:
Free parking on a hilly street, we arrived in the morning and the nearby car parks were already full. This street is not paid, but the one below it already has a parking meter and is a yellow zone. Perfect place to go for a walk downtown through the Alfama neighborhood.
CAREFUL! On Tuesdays and Saturdays there is a market and you cannot park.

title: (2925-500) São Lourenço (Vila Nogueira de Azeitão - 1A Rua Patrício Nunes
title_short: (2925-500) São Lourenço (Vila Nogueira de Azeitão - 1A Rua Patrício Nunes
description:
This is the best public spot to park day/night around Vila Nogueira de Azeitão, really quiet and secure in the night. Near a very nice green park equipped with a playground, skate park, basketball area, futebol area, padel courts and public toilets. Also near a municipal pool, Lidl and the spectacular Bacalhoa Wine Cellars. Across the park there is access to the public transport network that can take you into Lisbon in less than 35 minutes. Setúbal, Arrábida beaches and Sesimbra are really near and also accessible by public transport.
From this point it's really easy to reach the most beautiful parts of Serra da Arrábida hiking or on a bike ride. Vila Nogueira de Azeitão as many cafes, restaurants and shops and is very nice to enjoy a relaxed visit.

title: (1100-036) Lisboa - 30 Rua Cais de Santarém
description: Parking next to the plaza del comercio, good place, no services, be careful of the keepers.

title: (1100-032) Lisboa - 116 Campo de Santa Clara
description: It is not a place to sleep since it seems like a troubled neighborhood, but to leave the car or the van during the day, it is quite cool. I spent the whole day outside with no problem. If you know how to read you will not have any problem with the market (Tuesday and Saturday)

title: (1950-242) Lisboa - J Rua Pereira Henriques
description: Big parking lot across the road from bars. Has a lot of space, a little noisy on the weekends, but overall, seems ok. 5 other motorhomes parked

title: (2900-052) Setúbal - 16A Avenida de Angola
description: Parking at the Lidl supermarket.

title: (1900) Lisboa - 24 Rua Lopes
description:
Little vacant lot accessable by the church car park. 
Suitable for a camper van rather than a fully fledged motorhome.
We stayed one night. 
Flat ground. Litter everywhere.
A bit of a shady area. 
Someone in a car near us was flicking their lighter on and off in the late hours of the evening, heating up something nondescript...
Don't expect to feel particularly safe. Free parking in near the centre is hard to find.

title: (1950) Lisboa - R Cintura do Porto
description: No facilities but great place for spending night/few nights. Right on the walking/jogging promenade and bus stop. Ocean view with low/high tide, bar with snacks nearby, about 2 kms to Oceanarium by foot.

title: (1900-284) Lisboa - 56 Rua Simões Telhadas
description: Located in centre off an old neigborhood in green area. high ground with view to the largest cemitery in Portugal.

title: (1170) Lisboa - 61 Avenida Mouzinho de Albuquerque
description: Place to sleep or leave the free van. Sand floor To go to the center of Lisbon, take the bus 706 right in front and at 4-5 stops you will be dropped off at the Santa Apolonia train station. There are metro and buses that take you downtown. From the train station to the center there is a 15min walk to an area of ​​bars and shops. Gas station nearby, at about 150-200m.

title: (1900-159) Lisboa - 108 Estrada de Chelas
description: We have arrived late at night and we have spent the night here with our van, without any problem. It is a dead end street that ends up being a parking lot with grass. Above there is a small park, and below the train passes. At night there is almost no movement and one sleeps very peacefully. It has a bus stop nearby. In 20 minutes you are in the center.

title: (2865-759) Fernão Ferro - 3 N378
description: Gas station with a free water pump open 24/7

title: (2855-599) Corroios - 9 Rua Santiago Kastner
description:
Good clean laundry
 service with parking in the road outside
   small bar opposite with sushi restaurant. supermarket
at the end of the road .

title: (2855) Corroios - 11 Avenida Vieira da Silva
description: Just parking lot, spacious, well lit and quiet during night. We spent here just one night because official parking was full, moved there in the morning, it’s very close.

title: (1950-323) Lisbon - I Rua Cintura do Porto
title_short: (1950-323) Lisbon - I Rua Cintura do Porto
description: Parking lot by the river in an industrial area.

title: () Almada - Av. Aliança Povo
description: Firefighters parking, without electricity or water .... ideal place to visit Almada or Lisbon.

title: (2800-300) Almada - 4A Avenida 25 de Abril de 1974
description: Perfect parking, very close to lisbon! it's a big space on the hill surrounded by trees, not much noise and you can choose between the view on whole lisbon or the sea!  the boats leave every 15 minutes and take 5 minutes to lisbon . there is a bakery, an organic grocery and laundry nearby. we stayed there for two nights without any issues.

title: (2900-322) Setúbal - 226 Rua Batalha do Viso
description: We travel in a minivan camper car, so we always look for places a little far from the center. This place is in a residential area, only neighbors walked with dogs, very nice! We came in the middle of August and there weren't many people, yes, it is in front of some schools, maybe in other months there would be more people.

title: (1170-009) Lisboa - 88 Rua Castelo Branco Saraiva
description: Calm place at night. Free from night Friday til Sunday at night, pay rest week. Good place.

title: (2800-253) Almada - N10
description: Parking free 24 hours, has no electricity nor water .... ideal place to visit Almada or Lisbon.

title: (2855-501) Corroios - 6A Praça Latino Coelho
description: Laundromat near free RV park, 3 mins walk! Three washing machines of different sizes from 4.5 euros to 9.0, two dryers, 2 euros for 15 minutes, after that the laundry was perfectly dry. Open from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m

title: (2900-209) Setúbal - 23 C Estrada Algodeia
description: Here's a great option for a quiet night's sleep in Setúbal, right by Parque Infantil da Algodeia. Great with a dog. The "Parque da Algodeia" right next to it and the "Parque do Bonfim" also right around the corner.

title: (1170) Lisboa - T1 Rua Frei Manuel do Cenáculo
title_short: (1170) Lisboa - T1 Rua Frei Manuel do Cenáculo
description: Good parking lot for small vans. Very quiet at night. Free from Friday evening till Monday morning.

address.street: T1 Rua Frei Manuel do Cenáculo

title: (2800-270) Almada - 141 Largo dos Bombeiros Voluntários
description: Auto Serviços Central De Almada Lda - old garage turned carpark. Some class A motorhomes at the back, plenty of room for vans etc. Poor reviews on Google don't ring true. The old lady is still there, but  friendly and jolly so all good. EUR 2 for 2hrs so not too bad.

title: (1170) Lisboa - 3 Avenida General Roçadas
description: Calm and quiet parking to spend the night. Free from 7 p.m. to 9 a.m. the next day. Small restaurants nearby. I recommend the Nepalé restaurant which is 300m to the left when leaving the car park under the arches of a building.

title: (2855-702) Corroios - 32 Avenida Amélia Rey Colaço
description: Close to the city of Almada and a municipal park with places for children to play. Cafes and mini supermarkets nearby. Allows the van to be parked for 72 hours. No parking from July 15th to September 15th! Only the eastern part and northern part areas are for guests, the other areas are for permanent residents who need to register.

title: (1170-147) Lisboa - 8B Rua Professor Celestino da Costa
title_short: (1170-147) Lisboa - 8B Rua Professor Celestino da Costa
description: Very quiet to park within the city, near a school (AM noise). It is leveled for motorhomes.

title: (2910-031) Setúbal - Unnamed Road
description: Park next to shopping center.

title: (1100-052) Lisboa - 1B Praça da Figueira
description: Very well located car park right in the center. underground 2.30m high for campers and vans is perfect. From 10:30 am to 4:00 pm we paid. the prices in the car park were incomprehensible. The machine only accepts cash.

title: (1170) Lisboa - 76A Rua da Bombarda
description: Parking place near Lidl. It used to be a paid parking, but now gates always open. Quiet.

title: (1100-341) Lisboa - 45 Praça Martim Moniz
description: Parking day and night guarded (video surveillance) height 2.3m.

title: (1170) Lisboa - 9 Rua Maria da Fonte
description: Parking at the foot of a building, flat, near the city center (about 1 km).  We stayed here on a Friday night in August, there was little overnight stay.  There is a cafe and a grocery store across the street, Lidl supermarket just above.  No convenience. (Translated by Google)

title: (2925) Azeitão - 156 Rua do Fisco
description: Small public source. Not drinkable

title: (2910-108) Setúbal - 12 Rua Doutor Evaristo Sousa Gago
title_short: (2910-108) Setúbal - 12 Rua Doutor Evaristo Sousa Gago
description:
Paved and delimited parking area where we already find several motorhomes and vans
Although the spaces are standard, they do not have a curb that marks the sidewalk and you can park in the back so as not to take up too much space. Our vehicle is a 6 meter van

title: (2805) Almada - 21A Rua Maria Lamas
description: Space for washing and drying clothes with the option of ironing (there is a lady who does it on site with an extra cost) there is free parking but sometimes difficult...

title: (1900) Lisboa - 282 Rua Capela
description: Free parking near cemetery for camper vans. Walking distance from city centre. My car stayed here 5 nights in December with no problems. No services.

title: (2900-616) Setúbal - 20 Rua E do Bairro João Ferreira
title_short: (2900-616) Setúbal - 20 Rua E do Bairro João Ferreira
description: Unpaved square for parking by residents. The camper is tolerated. Dirty place (dog droppings) but quiet and close to the center. For shorter motorhomes only.

address.street: 20 Rua E do Bairro João Ferreira

title: (1249-249) Lisboa - Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa
title_short: (1249-249) Lisboa - Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa
description: This area is a bit scary, I think it is good to point out not to park here.. a lot of drunk people in the middle of the day.. go your way for your safety.

address.street: Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa

title: (2910-112) Setúbal - 10 Rua Bombeiros de Setúbal
description: Sand court, which is relatively uneven, but very large, so it is also suitable for large vehicles. Shopping center with many shops within walking distance.

title: (2805) Almada - 14 Rua Moçambique
description: Parking not very touristy but quiet, means of transport nearby

title: (1990-221) Lisboa - 308 Passeio Adamastor
description: A laundromat on the corner, see pictures for prices

title: (2910) Setúbal - 33 Rua Bombeiros de Setúbal
description: In front of the ALEGRO shopping center, there is transit of vehicles but it is a good point even if on a slight slope.

title: (1990-108) Lisboa - 2.03 Alameda dos Oceanos
description: Another laundromat. cheaper than the other.

title: (2900-300) Setúbal - Estr. do Castelo de São Filipe
title_short: (2900-300) Setúbal - Estr. do Castelo de São Filipe
description: Place to park right before the castle, up to 8m of length should not be a problem

address.street: Estr. do Castelo de São Filipe

title: (2900-412) Setúbal - 281 Avenida Luísa Todi
description:
Online parking, in a very crowded area, and close to a police station.
Like the entire center of Setúbal, it is payable with a parking meter from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. the price is €3.20 every 4 hours. It is attached to the entire interesting area, and it has given me more security than other nearby car parks that appeared in the area.

title: (2925) - 150 EM528
description: Shaded spot under cork oaks. Quiet and fairly flat. No services - leave no trace!

title: (2900-464) Setúbal - 357 Avenida Luísa Todi
description: Level parking with enough space for a 6 meter van. Payment is made from Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. and on Saturdays from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Overnight stays are allowed. It is close to the beach and different restaurants, both local food and pubs. Highly recommended to spend the night.

title: (2900) Setúbal - Estrada do Castelo de São Filipe
title_short: (2900) Setúbal - Estrada do Castelo de São Filipe
description: Parking of Sao Filipe Castle. many visitors during the day. very nice visit of the castle possible and free but with superb view on setubal.

address.street: Estrada do Castelo de São Filipe

title: (1200-109) Lisboa - Armazém 65 Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa
title_short: (1200-109) Lisboa - Armazém 65 Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa
description: Small car park between two restaurants along the port of Lisbon paying from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m., nice view remains to be seen security

address.street: Armazém 65 Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa

title: (2900-362) Setúbal - 25 Rua Primeiro de Maio
description: Parking lot hidden from main street. It is noisy at early hours because of the nearby market.

title: (2900) Setúbal - 22 Rua Hermínia Silva
description: Free public parking in setubal. For the day only

title: (2900-597) Setúbal - 5A Travessa Saboaria
description: Place where I spent the night and where there are usually more motorhomes and cars. Quiet and with good restaurants nearby.

title: (1950-442) Lisboa - B Avenida República da Bulgária
title_short: (1950-442) Lisboa - B Avenida República da Bulgária
description: It’s not amazing but I stayed parked during the day while going to town and talked to some locals who said it’s ok to stay .. there are shopping possibilities like super market and pharmacy..

title: (2900-412) Setúbal - 1 Rua João de Deus
description: Stop for the night. Free from 7:00 p.m. to 9:00 a.m., during the day you have to pay at the parking machine. We used it to spend the night because it gave us security to be right in front of the fire brigade. On the whole avenue nice restaurants. It's noisy at night, we stopped here to catch the ferry to Troia the next morning.

title: (1200-450) Lisboa - 32 Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa
title_short: (1200-450) Lisboa - 32 Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa
description: Previously a paid car park, now one row of free spaces just off the main road. No signage regarding campers. Stealthy overnight also likely possible though it can be seen from the road.

address.street: 32 Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa

title: (2900-579) Setúbal - 22 N10-4
description: Two water taps possibly allowing the filling of containers. it is along the beach and therefore quite frequent but it can help out.

title: (2900-579) Setúbal - 122A Avenida José Mourinho
description: Online parking in front of the Rockalot (beach bar). It is next to the GNR headquarters so no problem. Beach 15 meters away and Setúbal center 15 minutes walk. We spent 2 nights and terrific

title: (2900-597) Setúbal -
description: We spent one night in that parking lot, it is indicated that it is for professional fishermen, but another person with a van asked the police and they said that nothing was wrong. We were in total 3 Spanish vans and a whole day. There are quite a few people who go with their cars to see the sea at night and in the morning all kinds of people park up to go to the beach next door. We were a daily day and there are places to dine and others. I recommend it 100%.

title: (2910-640) Setúbal - Av. Dom Joao II
description: Location next to a Galp station, we saw a few motorhomes and parked without problem

title: (2900) Setúbal - 94 Avenida José Mourinho
description: We have parked here and spent the night without any problem.

title: (2805) Almada - IC20
description: Now it's a big paying parking lot with a huge biodiversity park, open 24/7, good for a walk with the dog (also there's a dog activity park) you have 3 hours for free, then paid. Good place to sleep if you don't mind to pay, also good for lunch or just stopping by for a while

title: (1200-868) Lisboa - 254 Avenida Brasília
description: Paid parking ( to be paid in coins) right next to the Santos metro. Good spot for exploring the city. We didn't spend the night but it looks ok.

title: (1950-116) Lisboa - 108 Rua Engenheiro Ferreira Dias
description: Municipality has forbidden RV’s and/caravans. police already toll some. be careful if parked more than a few hours.

title: (1000-098) Lisbon - 171 Avenida Almirante Reis
description: Open-air city car park, monitored and paying with reception, places reserved for long vehicles. We left our van there for 2 nights without a problem, we didn't sleep there.

title: (2910-725) Setúbal - 11C Rua Engenheiro Ferreira Dias
description: Petrol stadion with LPG

title: (2910-296) Setúbal - 17B Rua José António da Conceição
title_short: (2910-296) Setúbal - 17B Rua José António da Conceição
description: Supermarket parking with sleeping pots. The supermarket opens at 8:30. Bugaderia service. Gasoli was. Hi has also a proper pizzeria. Quiet area for sleeping.

title: (2910) Setúbal - N10
description: Laundromat outside, in front of bricomarche. 4eur/8kg

title: (1200-870) Lisbon - 320 Avenida Brasília
description: Free parking and flat in a quiet street, very convenient view the galley to park in this city with our 13 tons. Next to a bike path that makes the whole coast of Lisbon.

title: () Almada - 63 Avenida Cristo Rei
description: Free day or night parking, without a ban, just outside Christo Rei Park, on the sidewalks of the avenue. A bit noisy during the day with traffic but relatively quiet at night except for some planes in take-off or landing phase, we were alone that night. In any case more calm and without risk than the parking lots Avenue Brasília almost all forbidden to the motorhomes now. No service

title: (1800) Lisboa - Estrada de São Cornélio
description: Parking near the cemetery, perfect for overnight, very quiet, in the morning park cars from the offices, is 15 minutes walk from the oceanarium. In the park of the nations.

title: (1250-236) Lisboa - 1 Largo de São Mamede
description: Drinking water fountain on the square in front of the church. Unfortunately very slow drip speed.

title: (1950-011) Lisboa - WC Avenida Santo Condestável
description: Top up with water with good water pressure! Refueling and large garbage cans.

title: (2900) Setúbal - N10-4
description: Parking for 5 motorhomes, we spend the night together with 5 more motorhomes as the campsite is full. Some noise on the road but good views.

title: (1700-031) Lisboa - 15 Avenida Almirante Gago Coutinho
description: Large car park directly at the bus and metro stops. Ideal for learning about Lisbon. The parking spaces are large enough for campers. The car park is operated 24 hours a day with lighting. We didn't spend the night ourselves, but saw other motorhomes that spent the night here.

title: (2815-672) Sobreda - 11 Praceta Quinta do Bau-Bau
description: Large parking lot: one part tarred and the other part in the ground to install the tents there is no water, no electricity, no garbage. it is right in front of the continent, ideal for shopping. roadside parking but not too noisy.

title: (2900) Setúbal - Unnamed Road
description:
Parking next to the Setubal campsite; good access for all types of housing vehicles; unlevel area.

In front of a small beach.
Next to Restaurant without dinners.
Great for Dogs.


During the day it is used for locals to use their boats, so in the morning 4x4s with trailers begin to arrive, and other people so that the taxi boat can bring them closer to their boats.

It is ideal to arrive around 7:30 p.m. and spend the night.

Around 3 seats.
When we arrived, at the end of August, there was only one AC and one Camper.


PLEASE DON'T LITTER THE PLACE


"Courage and Freedom"

title: (2815) Sobreda - 1 Rua Quinta da Várzea
description: Parking area with green field and a lake. Very quiet for a couple of nights. Supermarket Continente at 100m and Intermarche caravan services at 500m.

name: EcoParque do Outão
title: (2900) EcoParque do Outão
description:
Nice campsite for mobile homes, caravans and tents. Hot showers and some new sanitary facilities in neat and clean condition. Supply and disposal are possible. You stand in a bay overlooking Setubal and the sea. The price includes showers, toilets, waste water and water tanks. Small bungalows are also available. Attention only busy from 9am to 7pm (arrival possible).
Note: they do not take pitch reservations.

title: () Lisboa - Rocha do Conde de Óbidos
title_short: () Lisboa - Rocha do Conde de Óbidos
description: Port parking no convenience, cycle path to go to town, avenue opposite, very noisy.

title: (2805) Almada - Avenida José Cardoso Pires
description: Gravel place without any signage, but there are cars parked there all day long. Ground noise level is quite high by the highway in the immediate vicinity. I would not want to spend the night here, but to explore the city on foot the parking was good.

title: (2805) Almada - Avenida José Cardoso Pires
description: Located opposite the entrance to Lisbon, take the bridge over the mouth, take the first right on the fast lane then right again after the petrol station. indication of Christo. is turning right at the roundabout, just before going over the bridge lane. 10 minutes walk to the monument of Christ.

title: (2820-246) Charneca de Caparica - nº22 Estrada Quinta da Carcereira
title_short: (2820-246) Charneca de Caparica - nº22 Estrada Quinta da Carcereira
description: Free ASA, always open and near a laundry station, low-cost gas station, Intermarché, Bricomarché and Roady. The area has no heigt limit, but there is one road access with a 3,5m limit.

title: (2820) Charneca de Caparica - 10B Rua Leite de Faria
title_short: (2820) Charneca de Caparica - 10B Rua Leite de Faria
description: Near the shops Intermarché and Bricomarché, laundry and drying clothes. Other services too

title: (1350-352) Lisboa - Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa
title_short: (1350-352) Lisboa - Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa
description: Great place.Paying fee. Near the port, through the main road and the railway noise is tolerable. Parking is not right on the street. Illuminated at night. Adjacent bike path to the center. At the weekend in high season. Loud music. Park better at the entrance. In the back near the boats

address.street: Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa

title: (1990) Lisboa - Travessa Sindbad O Marinheiro
description: Parking between residences. A temporary solution, much quieter than under the bridge to the North. Slight slope

name: Camping Picheleiros
title: (2925) Camping Picheleiros
description: A calm and relaxed Park in a natural reserve either for tents or motorhomes. Showers, little restaurant and electricity (low rating).Very narrow and steep road to campsite.

address.street: Vale de Picheleiros S. Caetano CCI 103 Serra da Arrábida, 346

title: (2925-346) Azeitão - 14 N379-1
description: 180 degrees panoramic view on Lisbon, the hills around and Setubal with its bay. At night with the city lights it is even more beautiful. It could become very windy and the internet signal is often weak, but none of these bothered us. You can see 4 million people, but no one can see you. We spent here a very quiet night alone.

title: (1250-087) Lisboa - 11 Rua Coelho da Rocha
description: A quite well-equipped laundry where cash and coins are accepted. It is easy to struggle with finding a parking place but managable. On sundays it is free to park around but otherwise one have to pay for that

title: (1950-037) Lisboa - 114A Avenida Almirante Gago Coutinho
description: Small parking lot at very busy street!

title: (1350-352) Lisboa - 5 Rua General Gomes Araújo
description: Secure place for a night or two close to Lisbon. Out of sight of the road and close to the port. Quick access to Lisbon on foot or by bike. Garbage cans and very large parking all around the port. Space for at least 8 motorhomes

title: (1000) Lisboa - 56A Avenida Defensores de Chaves
description: Street parking paying from 09:00 to 19:00. Free in the evening from 19:00 to 09:00. Somewhat noisy place to sleep with traffic until about 23:00. But with incognito van/camper nobody will notice. Many similar places in this area can be found if you arrive at night. Day time is super busy

title: (1950-074) Lisboa - 19 Rua Norte Júnior
description: Area where parking is tolerated by RV’s and caravans, near bus station

title: (1990-385) Lisboa - N10 Passeio dos Jacarandás
description: Good place to spend the night. Very shady. Very quiet bar. Some supermarket nearby. Right next to the Teixo River promenade, where you can picnic, walk, do some exrcise...Riverfront restaurants 10-15 min away on foot.

title: (2900) Setúbal - N379-1
description: Small car park, rather flat, on the edge of the very beautiful N379-1. Very quiet road at night, therefore very quiet. Enough places for 2/3 Motorhomes + 2 places in the shade for VL or van. View over the bay of Troia / Setubal. No service.

title: (1350-168) Lisboa - 60B Rua Infantaria 16
description: Free Sunday and 20-9am. Hard to find space, but great area. For campers and ac up to 5m!!!

title: () - N379-1
description: Small parking lot next to the road. At most 2 large camping cars fit. The views are spectacular of the Bay of Setubal. Very quiet to sleep, because at night vehicles do not circulate on the road.

title: (1350) Lisboa - Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa
title_short: (1350) Lisboa - Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa
description: Paid parking every 15 min and max. 5 euros a day. Many trees and shade almost all day

address.street: Rua da Cintura do Porto de Lisboa

title: (1070-051) Lisboa - 39 Rua Marquês de Fronteira
description: Next to Jardim Amália Rodrigues & Parque Eduardo VII with amazing view. Can recommend the Linha d’Agua cafe. There’s an outdoor fitness workout park nearby & lots of places to eat within walking distance. Next to the prison! Near fairly busy road.

title: (2925) Azeitão - N379-1
description: Shaded picnic area, roadside, table, barbecue, and trash. Place flat and relatively clean. A creek at the bottom (dry at end of July), the road is a little busy but quiet from 21h.

title: (1070) Lisboa - 22 Rua Marquês de Fronteira
description: Paid parking, 3 euros per day. During the day it may be full, pay from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m.

title: (1300-611) Lisboa - 17 Rua das Fontaínhas
description: Paid parking to stay max 4h

title: (1990-503) Sacavém - 19 Passeio das Gáveas
description: Authorized parking, quiet and safe place near the police station

title: (1300-611) Lisboa - 55 Rua das Fontaínhas
description: Discreet side street next to the paid parking lot. Suitable for smaller vans 6m max. Cafe, supermarket and free public showers were super close. Felt a lot safer than other parks around the area.

title: (2820-567) Aroeira - 83 Avenida Dom Afonso Henriques
description: A normal ALDI parking lot. Nothing special, they always look the same. However, this also has four parking spaces designated for mobile homes. You stand at ground level and it seems to be a fairly quiet area.

title: (1300-611) Lisboa - 38 Rua Alcântara
description: Laundromat with many machines. 4.5 machine 9kg and 1.8 the dryer. Hard to park next door but bus stop nearby, coffee shop next door to wait.

title: (1300-370) Lisboa - 2 Rua Padre Adriano Botelho
description: 'Balneário público de Alcântara' Free public showers for men and women. Open 7h30-12h00 Wednesday - Saturday. There is a toilet and shower cubicles and benches. Cubicles are large, the water is hot and has good pressure. They can provide you with a towel, soap and shampoo and clothes for free if needed.

title: (1990) Sacavém - Passeio do Teja
description: Large parking lot without lines. flat and sunny. we stayed 3 months, it does not bother anyone, we were safe and it's calm. Very close fountain, and garbage cans collected every day. very clean and well maintained park. if you are at the bottom of the parking lot, you can receive the tennis wifi. bus line 708 at the foot of the parking lot to reach the metro. BE CAREFUL for the route, put the roundabout otherwise the gps will take you over the bridge !! by 12m bus KarasGo family route's

title: (1300-553) Lisboa - 103 Rua Rodrigues de Faria
description: The parking lot next to the LX factory. 2 euros per day and no official height limit but some lines at the entrance. You can push it up and you'll be fine.

title: (2900-182) Setúbal Municipality - Forte Velho do Outão
title_short: (2900-182) Setúbal Municipality - Forte Velho do Outão
description: Abandoned fort, former defense site of the bay of Setubal. exceptional site overlooking the bay. Considering the lack of spots in the region, this place seemed perfect to spend the night but we quickly became disillusioned, a lot of comings and goings, gatherings of noisy young people ... and this despite the fact that we were on weekdays. At 2 am still impossible to sleep. We do not recommend going to land in the back of the site near the cannons if you want to be quiet. The parking lot at the entrance to the site is perhaps less busy. Short site to see but not relaxing.

title: (1300) Lisbon -
description: Parking lot below the highway, relatively noisy, was safe during the day and overnight. In the morning, if you ask nicely, you can take a shower at the tennis club right next door.

title: (1990) Sacavém - 46 Rua Príncipe Mónaco
description: I have stayed in this place next to another motorhome. It is a quiet place and close to bus stop.

title: (1990) Lisboa - Rua Chen He
description: Small parking lot next to a skate park, pump track and fitness area. Right under the big bridge. Nice atmosphere right next to a park.

title: (1990) Sacavém - Passeio dos Heróis do Mar
title_short: (1990) Sacavém - Passeio dos Heróis do Mar
description: Good spot to land, lots of space for animals, several free parking at the edge of the park.

title: (1990) Lisboa - Caminho das Cegonhas
description: Paid parking under overpass. Next to skatepark, water tap for drinking at the skatepark. Local make out spot so a lot of coming and going

title: (1700-111) Lisboa - 561B Estrada da Portela
description: Parking free in lisbon

title: (1700-111) Lisboa - Av. Berlim
description: P3 guarded car park with flat and shaded spaces. No problem with our 3m high van. 15 euros for 24 hours. Metro for Lisbon 5 minutes walk from the car park for 1.50e. Beware of many thefts in broad daylight of motorhomes on car parks at 3 euros without surveillance.

title: (1300) Lisboa -
description: Super parking for the day for the night I do not know because it is just below the bridge and the crossing of 2 big roads .... but to go to LX factory is ideal. and we have nothing to pay and nothing is to indicate.

title: (1600-007) Lisbon - 12d Avenida Álvaro Pais
description: Parking on the street with slots of a bigger size. Payed by parking meter. Very near the train and metro station (Entrevampos) and bus stops to visit the center. There’s shade by the afternoon.
